item.title: On noncontinuous bisymmetric strictly monotone operations
item.description: arXiv:2601.16247v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this paper, we construct a bisymmetric, strictly increasing, symmetric binary operation $F$ on an interval which is not continuous. This answers a natural question in the study of bisymmetric and mean-type operations by showing that continuity may fail even for non-reflexive operations of the form \[ F(x,y)=f^{-1}\bigl(\alpha f(x)+\beta f(y)\bigr), \] where $f$ is a bijection between an interval and a perfect, nowhere dense fractal-type set, and $\alpha,\beta>0$ with $\alpha+\beta\neq 1$. As a consequence, we also obtain a noncontinuous, associative, strictly increasing, symmetric operation on an interval. We generalize these constructions to the multivariate case. We also prove a complementary result: if a symmetric, bisymmetric, strictly increasing operation is reflexive at the endpoints of an interval, then it must be continuous and coincide with a quasi-arithmetic mean on that interval.
item.dc:creator: Gergely Kiss

item.title: A systematic approach to Diophantine equations: open problems
item.description: arXiv:2404.08518v4 Announce Type: replace Abstract: This paper collects polynomial Diophantine equations that are amazingly simple to write down but are apparently difficult to solve.
